markdownRemark.html:
TL;DR

Almost everyone feels the effects of imposter syndrome from time to time.

What is Imposter Syndrome?

Imposter syndrome is when you don’t think you are good enough for the task at hand. It may be a job interview, trying to lead a project, or anything else you wish to accomplish but feel inadequate to do.

It is a real phenomenon and does not affect just software developers. It can impact all areas of work and all levels of expertise.

What To Do About It

In my opinion the best thing to do is make sure imposter syndrome does not cause you to miss opportunities for improvement (promotion, leadership, job, etc.). Don’t not apply for a job because you think you aren’t capable. Now, this does have to be within reason. For example, if you have six months of experience then don’t apply for a job that requires 10 years of experience.

What I am saying though is that the inner-doubt shouldn’t be the thing that holds you back from attaining your goals.

frontmatter.title: Imposter Syndrome
frontmatter.description: Are feelings of imposter syndrome normal?
